name: Shipment from Edge of World
description: Build a fat remote with Edge of World and wait the Snare/Fetal AI access

name: Anarch v2
Wide Jinteki v2
Brain wash
Faerie Kate
description: The idea is to derez ICE untill they have nothing left. Simple enough to play as well.

name: Kate lot of money
Good Weyland
NBN: Shenanigans
description:
I couldn't think of another name for this deck, based on the odd interactions between some of the cards. RSVP could go in front of something with a Red Herrings or just a Pop-up Window. Bait the click-thru on Eli into an Ichi for some program trashing. Data Raven into a Muckraker, silly things like that. Plus the odd ball Rex Campaign to off set the Bad Pub on Muckraker and using Izzy McGuire to restructure my ICE if I have sub-optimal placement from the early game.

The rest is my usual "High Value Target" build with most things being 5 credits to trash and I run multiples and recursion so the runner will go broke trying to run them down, or if he leaves them, they help ensure a victory anyway.

name: HB Brain Damage
Chaos Scavenge
Chaos Scavenge
Red Queen's Master Key
description: Fast Fast. Looking for feedback

name: Jinteki J-How shenanigans
description: Hide the agendas in archives with shocks and pull what you want out when they run for it.

name: Macgyver 2.0
description: A tweaked list to be a bit faster and more reliable than my first attempt. Maker's Eye out for R&D Interface and made room for a Sharpshooter. SMCs were added to be a bit quicker and are mostly for pulling out SS or DE in case I hit something terrible. Otherwise it's install the cheap ones as normal (usually for free), save the Modded for Toolbox, RDI, or MO if I really need the money. Femme's only come out via Test Runs to skip into a server for a big dig or an Infiltrated remote that holds the winning point.

name: Aggressive Red Queen
description: Keyhole + Knight for early pressure. Emergency Shutdown is amazing to keep corp defenses out and Clone Chip to bring back Knights or Parasites. There is another, more aggressive version with AS and Plascretes instead of ES + CC

name: Whitetree 2.0
description:
I've been playing this deck in various forms for about two months. It plays a much more "straightforward" game than other Jinteki decks, in that I'm taking advantage of the ID ability to create better scoring windows.

The punishing ICE goes on centrals to slow the runner down the runner trying to get to the remotes. Himitsu-Bako and Paper Wall can protect R&D for a turn or two before the econ is ready to rez the more expensive punishing ice. Lots of econ assets to take advantage of the extra tax on remote servers.

PSF should probably leave for something else; Fetal perhaps. Unorthodox Predictions has a GREAT ability (I nearly always choose Sentries unless I've already installed another agenda behind a Barrier) but feels like a lot of work for just one point.

TOL is there to recover failed traps/traps used at advancement banks, but it's tough to reliably pull that off. Perhaps I should cut back on the traps/cut out TOL in favor of something else, say Hokusai or Neural EMP?

name: Fae Rush Agent
description: Dig where ever you need to with this deck. Two forms of Econ

name: Reina  Knight v2.0 (pro con)
description:
I've had so-so success with this deck, but it is a little toolboxy. Reina or Whizzard doesn't matter, that's more a meta call on if NBN or Weyland is more prominent. I chose Reina because her ability is good except against those random iceless decks.

Goal is to get Knights on Targeted servers as needed. It's effectively an inside job in most cases. Knights can move to R&D if they have a Sansan I can't trash.

Card choices: I want Knight and not Crypsis or Darwin because it is insanely efficient. With e3 Knight is deadly. Problem is tutoring for it. ProCon: v1 is Wyldside+Aesop, but that is finicky and fragile. And I need the click for other things. v2 with ProCon has been great. Parasite to get rid of annoying things like Popup or Enigma. Mimic is there for Roto/Tsuragi/Katana. Corroder is there because Ice Wall/Paper Wall/Hadrian's/Curtain. Yog is not there because the 5 credits can be rough on tempo. Deep Red is there because it's a Caissa deck.

name: Scavenge Chaos Theory w/ Keyhole
description:
Use Test Run, Scavenge/Eureka for breaker suite when convenient. Put Morning Star on Dino. Same Old Thing is for consistency.

Econ: Armitage, Sure Gamble, Easy Mark, Dirty Laundry, Kati (late)

Tinkering puts early pressure on the corp to steal 1st agenda. Test run can accomplish this too.

Infiltration ensures your stealing an agenda every time.

After your breaker suite is out and the corp is afraid to play agendas, use keyhole as finisher.

name: celebrities love their ice 3.0
Keyhole!
description: Bleh

name: Asset-less IceWalls
description:
Hi! My first deck here. The basic concept is to have only one uber protected extrernal server and stack ice on RnD and External server, leaving hand open or low ice protection. Low number of Agendas makes possible to have only 1 accessible agenda at time, while high number of ices with spread costs makes multiple walls effective without to being to costly. Biodroid research and Oversight AI are here to power up defences against midgame aggressions without spending to much resouces, that are involved in stackin ices and advancing agendas, while shipment form sansan make things faster.

This slot it mostly customizable, you can switch with padcampaing for a long-term advantage or Tyr's Hand for maximum biodroid efficency.

I'd appreciate any suggestion :) Thx for reading.
